title: Kim Kardashian revealed the release date for husband Kanye West’s latest album on Instagram after it was delayed
text:
Kanye West's highly-anticipated ninth album — "Jesus is King" — was set for release on Friday, but delays have left fans wondering when they'll get new music from Yeezy.

Friday evening, Kim Kardashian West announced via posts on Twitter and Instagram that her husband's new album will drop Sunday and that an IMAX film titled "Jesus is Lord" will be available to fans in October.

This isn't the first album West has delayed recently, as the rapper postponed a previous project titled "YANDHI" indefinitely after multiple delays.

Visit Insider's homepage for more stories.

Kanye West was expected to drop his highly-anticipated ninth album — "Jesus is King" — on Friday, but with no new music materializing on its set release date, Yeezy faithful have been left guessing when they'll get new content from the "Stronger" and "Gold Digger" rapper.

But Kim Kadarshian West — West's wife and the mother of his four children — gave fans an updated timeline and a sneak peak at the album's tracklist via her Instagram and Twitter accounts.

After sharing footage of their 6-year-old daughter, North West, singing along to West's Sunday Service in Detroit on her Instagram story, Kardashian West posted what appears to be a handwritten tracklist for "Jesus is King" on Twitter and subsequently announced that the album will drop on Sunday after West hosts a pair of listening sessions this weekend.

—Kim Kardashian West (@KimKardashian) September 27, 2019

"Water," the fourth title listed on Kardashian West's tracklist, may be familiar to fans who keep a close eye on West, as he has performed the song at multiple of his Sunday Services — including the one he organized at Coachella earlier this year, according to Variety.

But other songs scrawled on the Marriott notepad came as more of a surprise to Yeezy enthusiasts. "New Body," a song West has reportedly been tweaking for months that leaked in July, has finally made its way into an album.

Fans suspected that the jam featuring artists Ty Dolla $ign and Nicki Minaj would be included in West's forthcoming project "YANDHI," which he delayed multiple times before postponing its release indefinitely with a tweet in November.

It wasn't the first time Kardashian West had revealed information about her husband's projects. In fact, the reality show star and fashion mogul first revealed the initial release date and tracklist for "Jesus is King" via her Twitter late last month.

—Kim Kardashian West (@KimKardashian) August 29, 2019

On Friday, Kardashian West also shared footage of a listening event for the album that her husband hosted at Detroit's Fox Theatre.

—Fox Theatre Detroit (@FoxTheatreDet) September 27, 2019

And she even released a video on her Instagram story of fans at the venue dancing to the second song on the aforementioned tracklist, which is titled "Follow God."

Read more: Kim Kardashian took fans inside Kanye West's new-age domes that he wants to turn into housing for the homeless

Kim Kardashian West shares a video of "Jesus is King" played for fans at Detroit's Fox Theatre on her Instagram story. Kim Kardashian/Instagram

West also shared a clip from his upcoming IMAX film — "Jesus is Lord" — with fans at Friday's event, and Kardashian West posted a video of the crowd taking it in with a note suggesting that the movie will be released in October.

Kim Kardashian West shares a video of "Jesus is Lord" on her Instagram story. Kim Kardashian/Instagram

According to Kardashian West, West will host another listening event in Chicago Saturday before traveling to New York City for one last fan preview prior to the release.
description: Kanye West's highly-anticipated ninth album was set for release on Friday, but delays have left fans wondering when Yeezy's "Jesus is King" will drop.
